page.title: 01Mow Cop Castle
page.content: Mow Cop castle was built on a ridge overlooking the surrounding countryside.It used to have a wall, a roof and a floor,all that remains now is a ruined wall and a stone built tower,which has three windows. The summer house was built in 1754 by the Wilbrahams who paid the Hardings to build it.Nobody is sure why it was built.Some people say it was built for people to enjoy,others say it is a folly.In 1850 there was a court case about the Wilbrahams and the Sneyds, about who owned. It was built on the border of Cheshire and Staffordshire. It was eventually decided that the Wilbrahams owned it. The summer house was given to the National Trust in 1937.
